title: What's happening this week for Fall for the Arts
text: What's happening this week for Fall for the Arts Comment Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 2:00 AM Updated Oct 2, 2015 at 10:43 AM Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 2:00 AM Updated Oct 2, 2015 at 10:43 AM » RELATED CONTENT Falmouth One-on-One Oil Painting Class, 9:30-noon, Fridays, Falmouth Art Center, 137 Gifford St.; 508-540-3304. Falmouthart.org . JazzFest Falmouth, “Jazz Stroll,” presented by ArtsFalmouth, 5:15 p.m.–10 p.m. Friday, along Main Street and Peg Noonan Park, 280 Main St.; 508-548-2892. Jazzfestfalmouth.org . CJAZZ at JazzFest Falmouth, 6:30-8 p.m. Friday, Falmouth Museums at the Green, 55 Palmer Ave.; 508-362-0066. jazzfestfalmouth.org . JazzFes t headliner concert with Denise Donatella, presented by ArtsFalmouth, 7:30 p.m.-10 p.m. Saturday, Highfield Theater, 58 Highfield Drive; 508-548-2892, jazzfestfalmouth.org . JazzFest Falmouth Jazz Brunch with Guitarists Goodis and Glenn, presented by ArtsFalmouth, 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Sunday, Persey’s Place, 40 North Main St.; 508-548-2892 jazzfestfalmouth.org . Estate Walk & History of the Beebe Property, 12:30-1:30 p.m. Sunday, Highfield Hall & Gardens, 56 Highfield Drive; 508-495-1878, ext. 2. highfieldhallandgardens.org . “A Painter’s Class –Developing Your Painting Style,” 5:30-8 p.m. Thursday, Falmouth Art Center, 137 Gifford St.; 508-540-3304. Falmouthart.org . “Step Outside,” Plein Air Painting Class with Betsy Payne Cook, 9-11:30 a.m. Thursday, Falmouth Art Center, 137 Gifford St.; 508-540-3304. Falmouthart.org . Mashpee “The Art of Sports,” Woodruff’s Art Center, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m.- 4 p.m. Sundays, 1 North Market St.; 508-477-5767. woodruffsartcenter.com . Sandwich The Heritage Collection, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. daily, Heritage Museums & Gardens American Art & Carousel Gallery, 67 Grove St;. 508-888-3300. heritagemuseumsandgardens.org . “Cutting Edge – A New Perspective on Glass” exhibit, 9:30 a.m.-5 p.m.daily , Sandwich Glass Museum, 129 Main St.; 508-888-0251. sandwichglassmuseum.org . “Ed Branson, Glass & Nature – Contemporary Gallery,” 9:30 a.m.- 5 p.m. daily, Sandwich Glass Museum, 129 Main St.; 508-888-0251. sandwichglassmuseum.org . “Scherenschnitte,” 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Mondays-Saturdays; noon-4 p.m. Sundays, Green Briar Nature Center, 6 Discovery Hill Road; 508-888-6870. Thorntonburgess.org . “Thornton W. Burgess: His Times, Life & Work 1874-1965,” 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Mondays-Saturdays ; noon-4 p.m. Sundays, Green Briar Nature Center, 6 Discovery Hill Road; 508-888-6870. Thorntonburgess.org . Cape Cod Cranberry Day, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday, Green Briar Nature Center, 6 Discovery Hill Road; 508-888-6870. Thorntonburgess.org . Fall Walking Tours of Sandwich Village, 10-11:30 a.m. Saturday, Sandwich Glass Museum, 129 Main St.; 508-888-0251. Barnstable “Jack and Bobby-Brothers First” exhibit, 9 a.m.-2 p.m.daily , and noon-5 p.m. Sunday, JFK Museum, 397 Main St., Hyannis; 508-790-3077. jfkhyannismuseum.org . “On Abstraction” at Osterville Village Library, 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays; 11 a.m.-7 p.m. Saturdays; 12:30-4 p.m. Sundays, Osterville Village Library, 43 Wianno Ave.; 508-428-5757. ostervillefreelibrary.org . “True Colors Fine Art Exhibit,” 9 a.m.-4 p.m. daily and Sunday noon-4 p.m., Cape Cod Art Association, 3480 Route 6A; 508-362-2909. capecodartassoc.org . “Pirates of Penzance,” 7:30 p.m. Friday and Thursday, 2 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, Cotuit Center for the Arts, 4404 Falmouth Road (Route 28); 508-428-0669. artsonthecape.org . The Art of Landscape Photography: Plymouth & The South Shore, 5-9 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, Cape Cod Art Association, 3480 Route 6A; 508-362-2909. capecodartassoc.org . Best of the Woods Hole Film Festival , presented by Cotuit Center for the Arts, 7:30-9:30 p.m. Sunday-Tuesday, 4404 Falmouth Road (Route 28).; 508-428-0669. artsonthecape.org . “Love, Loss, and What I Wore,” 8 p.m Thursday, Cotuit Center for the Arts, 4404 Falmouth Road (Route 28); 508-428-0669. artsonthecape.org . “Turn, Turn, Turn” exhibit, 11 a.m.–5 p.m. Thursday through Monday, Gallery Artrio on the HyArts Campus, 50 Pearl St., Hyannis; 508-827-4909, galleryartrio.com . South Yarmouth All at Cultural Center of Cape Cod, 307, Old Main St., 508-394-7100, cultural-center.org Reception for Four New Exhibits , 5-7 p.m. Friday Saturday Night Music Café with Two Cool , 8 p.m. Saturday “En Plein Air with a Focus on Color and Light,” a workshop with John Clayton, 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday and Sunday Pianist Thomas Pandolfi performs the music of Gershwin and Hamlisch, 7:30-9:30 p.m. Sunday Introduction to Drawing with Craig Caldwell , 10 a.m.-noon Tuesday Introduction to Oil Painting with Craig Caldwell , 1-3 p.m. Tuesday A Trio of Salsa Dance Classes, 7-8 p.m. Tuesday Dennis At Cape Cod Museum of Art, 60 Hope Lane; 508-385-4477; ccmoa.org unless otherwise noted Beginning Pottery, 6-8 p.m. Monday Painting Inspired by the Cape Workshop, 10 a.m.-noon, Tuesday Intermediate Pottery , 6-8 p.m Tuesday Watercolor Painting , 10 a.m.-noon, Wednesday Bead Weaving and Jewelry Basics for Teens , 4-5:30 p.m., Wednesday Precious Metal Clay Classes , 6-9 p.m. Wednesday "Clearly: Glass as Sculpture," 10 a.m.-5 p.m Thursday-Saturday, noon-5 p.m. Sunday After Hopper Plein Air Museum Exhibition, presented by Addison Art Gallery and Cape Cod Museum of Art, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon-5 p.m. Sundays; 508-255-6200 Pastels With a Punch, 9:30 a.m.-noon Thursday “Noted Art Films of the Past: Do They Hold Up?” 6-8:30 p.m. Thursday The Copley Society of Boston , 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Tuesday-Saturday, noon-5 p.m. Sunday Open Clay Studio , 6-8 p.m. Thursday Opening Reception: Land, Sea & Sky, 5-7 p.m. Friday, exhibit continues through Oct. 30 (call for hours), Miller White Fine Arts, 708 Route 134; 508-360-4302. millerwhitefinearts.com Harwich Painting the Town with the Guild of Harwich Artists , 1-4 p.m. Friday, Saturday and 1-6 p.m. Thursday, Brooks Academy Museum 80 Parallel St.; 508-432-8089. harwichhistoricalsociety.org . “The Great American Trailer Park Musical,” 7:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday, 4 p.m. Sunday, Harwich Junior Theatre, 105 Division St., West Harwich; 508-432-2002. hjtcapecod.org . Brewster Nickerson Lecture with William Kamkwamba, 7-8:30 p.m. Saturday, Brewster Baptist Church, 1848 Main St.; 508-896-3913. brewsterladieslibrary.org . Drawing From Nature with Eve Aspinwall , 9-11am. Thursday, Cape Cod Museum of Natural History, 869 Main St.; 508-896-3867 x133. ccmnh.org . Chatham All at Creative Arts Center, 154 Crowell Road, 508-945-3583; capecodcreativearts.org Third Annual September Invitational , 9 a.m.- 4 p.m. Friday Chatham Sparkles , 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Friday 11th Autumn Sacrifice Art Sale , 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Thursday Orleans Church of the Transfiguration Tour at The Community of Jesus , 3-7 p.m. Friday, The Church of the Transfiguration, Bay View Drive; 508-240-2400. churchofthetransfiguration.org . “A Celebration: 25 Years An Artist,” 10 a.m.–5 p.m. Saturday, Tuesday and Wednesday, The Gallery at Tree’s Place, 60 Rt. 6A; 508-255-1330. treesplace.com . Eastwind Gallery’s “Fall For the Arts” Open Studio Event , noon–5 p.m. Saturday, 34 Main St.; 508-240-2133. eastwindgallery.net . “Music at the Museum: Daniel del Pino,” piano, 3-5 p.m. Saturday, Orleans Historical Society Meetinghouse Museum, 3 River Road; 508-240-1329, orleanshistoricalsociety.org Eastham Farm & Sea-To-Table Dinner & Silent Auction , 6-9 p.m. Saturday, Nauset Regional High School, 100 Cable Road; 508-896-4267. nausetschools.org Wellfleet At Wellfleet Preservation Hall, 335 Main St., 508-349-1800, wellfleetpreservationhall.org unless otherwise noted Beginning Ballroom Dance Classes , 6-7 p.m. Tuesday Adult Ballet Class , 7-8 p.m. Tuesday Manhattan Short Film Festival , 7 p.m. Friday and Sunday MET Opera Live in HD: “Il Trovatore,” 12:55-3:40 p.m. Saturday, Wellfleet Harbor Actors Theater, The Julie Harris Stage, 2357 Route 6; 508-349-9428. what.org Truro Kenneth Hawkey exhibit at the Truro Council on Aging; opening reception 2 p.m. Sunday, Truro Community Center-COA, 7 Standish Way; 508-487-2462. truro-ma.gov . capecodtimes.com Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 2:00 AM Updated Oct 2, 2015 at 10:43 AM
